clinical_study.brief_title: Chinese Surgical Robot Clinical Study on Rectectomy for Rectal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Comparision of the Outcomes and Learning Curve of Rectectomy for Rectal Cancer Using Diverse Minimally Technologies: Surgical Robot "Micro Hand S", Laparoscope

lead_sponsor.agency: The Third Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

clinical_study.source: The Third Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

brief_summary.textblock: Central South University in collaboration with Tianjin University developed the first domestically produced Chinese minimally invasive surgical (MIS) robot system which named "Micro Hand S" in 2013. This new MIS robot had been authorized to enter the clinical trial stage by the Ethics Committee of the Third Xiangya Hospital at Central South University. The Micro Hand S robot is safe and feasible in the preliminary study. However, compared with minimally invasive approaches (da Vici, laparoscope), the merits and demrits of rectectomy for rectal cancer are unclear. Therefore, the investigators conduct this retrospective study to focus on this concern.

arm_group.description: This group is consisted of 40 cases performed using the Micro Hand S robot by one single surgeon for rectal cancer
This group is consisted of 65 cases performed using the laparoscope by one single surgeon for rectal cancer

intervention.description: The surgeries are performed with the Micro Hand S robot
The surgeries are performed with the laparoscope

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- histologically confirmed rectal cancer; ASA score < 3
Exclusion Criteria:
- palliative resections, combined resections, distant metastasis, a previous history of abdominal/or pelvic surgery
